name: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on the Las Vegas Strip

reviews.title: Loved the Hilton
reviews.text: I was contacted by a telemarking group with an offer to stay 2 nights for $271. We were already planning a trip that month so I took advantage of it. We were told we would need to listen to a time share presentation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Grand Vacations is on the strip, down near the Stratosphere. It does not have any casino's inside it. There is a oool, lounge room with pool table, couches, TV. The fitness room is next to the lounge. Down on the 1st floor is also a store & attached deli/bakery. You can get coffee, pizza, groceries, cake and many other things.
reviews.title: Good Choice!

reviews.text: Our room was a studio suite on the 28th floor. We had the view of the strip. The room was nice. The bed was totally comfy! Loved the bed. A flat screen TV and DVD player were also in the room, along with the mini kitchenette area.
reviews.title: Great place to stay again and again
Good
reviews.text: We had some minor maintenance issues they took care of quickly.
Cabs were easy to get and they had a $5.50 shuttle to the airport.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I paid $140 to visit for 2 days. My stay was so terrible, I left a day early. For $140 this is what I got: a small room, no kitchen (as promised), a less than par shower, disturbance in the middle of the night by drunkards, a mattress with springs poking in my back, a 7am wakeup call by the maid vacuuming next door and the gardener blowing leaves at the pool at the same time (which was heard on the 6th floor!), an unrequested solicitation call from concierge at 7:15am, and a terrible three hour orientation of why I should give Hilton $42K for a timeshare. I am simply shocked! BTW, parking is $8/night. This hotel is NOT "on the strip", plus no big hotel on the strip in Las Vegas charges for parking. If you are not a vacation owner, you will not get all the amenities they advertise.
reviews.title: Spare yourself the disappointment

reviews.text: Very clean and nice. Majorly lacks Las Vegas WOW factor. Boring, away from all the lights and action. View from my room was a construction site. Pool area was big and nice. Not much to offer food or drink wise after 9 or 10pm.
reviews.title: Clean and Quiet

reviews.text: And a great place to stay at in Vegas, whether through a timeshare exchange (as we did) or a rental. It's cheaper than the high-end places in Vegas (Bellagio and the like), but fairly luxurious in its own right. Two bedroom unit is fantastically equipped (love the washer/dryer). True, you're not in the heart of the Strip, but that can be a positive -- less noisy and there's no temptation to gamble since there's not a casino on the property. If you need action, you're a short drive away (I didn't try the public transportation options -- Vegas has free valet everywhere which makes traveling a breeze). It's also a very close walk to a pharmacy with some food items. And a close walk to Circus Circus (if you feel like gambling). Staff couldn't be nicer -- even the timeshare tour was relatively painless (and got us $100 in meal vouchers). Onsite deli/restaurant stays open late if you need anything -- food looks decent but we just went for coffee. If you stay for a week, you do get a free midweek cleanup, so your towel needs and the like will be covered.
reviews.title: One of the best Hilton Grand I've stayed in...

reviews.text: I stayed here during the summer hoping to have some of the relaxation of Las Vegas. I found the rooms to be really good and clean. I am not a fan of the grill or the pool. Was expecting a Vegas style layout.
reviews.title: Good Rooms, Average Amenities

reviews.text: Very reasonable, had a great room (size wise) but was let down by the cleanliness- the shower was very weak and was dripping, and the massive bed cussions were FILTHY - i put them on the floor but the maid kept putting the same sones back on my bed, there were bugs on them; i saw 2 LIVE BUGS on them and ONE in my bed upon arrival. it made the rest of my stay very uneasy as i constantly felt uneasy when in bed !! :(
reviews.title: cheap thrills
Top spot with none of casino hassles
reviews.text: My wife hated the thought of staying in a casino hotel and this was the perfect option. After the long flight from Australia, a painless check in was more than appreciated, Staff are friendly and helpful, overall facilities are just what you'd expect and location although at the north end of the strip means a fair bit of walking or taxi rides, it's near the monorail for another option.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are great and the king bed nice and roomy for us tall people. I'd go back in a blink !
reviews.title: Nice Property

likes.liked: — Great Pool, Easy Access to the Strip
likes.disliked: — Access to a cab when we needed one quickly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were in a one-bedroom suite. The room was big and we didn't use the living room space at all. The hotel was a bit away from the main strip which was nice because we didn't get a lot of traffic. Getting around was easy, there's a trolley that stops right outside of the hotel. We enjoyed the pool and their staff was really helpful. If you need to get to a show/restaurant, you'd better reserve a cab in advance or you'll never get there in time.
reviews.title: Lovely

likes.disliked: — use the bus instead of the monorail which is expensive $5 single trip, or walk!

reviews.text: The best bed I have ever slept on, I really didnt want to leave! We booked a king studio room for 3 nights which cost $87 thursday and $111 friday and Saturday night. The room also had a plasma TV, microwave, coffee maker, free starbucks coffee, fridge, blender, cutlery and crockery. We arrived really early in the morning and the hotel staff allowed us check in at 5am with no extra fee, the staff are very friendly. The hotel is facing the Sahara and next to Circus Circus. It takes about 20 - 30 mins to walk to the busier part of the strip Aladdin/ Paris/ Ballys or you can use the bus which is $2 single ride or $5 for a daily pass. We would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Beautiful New Hotel With Spectacular Rooms

likes.liked: — Size and comfort level of the room.
likes.disliked: — It just lacked a couple of amenities that I have come to expect from a Hilton.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were contacted by this property to attend a Grand Vacations Club timeshare sales presentation, and in return we would get a deluxe 1 bedroom suite on the Strip for 3 nights at $160 a night. There were wonderful things about the hotel, and some not so great things, but all in all I give this place 2 thumbs up.
reviews.title: Loved this resort!

reviews.text: I have been in Vegas with my family and enjoyed stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Good option

reviews.text: Good option if you want a quiet location, but not far away from main center of Las Vegas Strip. It has no casino inside - great advantage.
reviews.title: Great hotel if staying in Vegas more than two or three days

reviews.text: Big and comfortable rooms.
reviews.title: A utterly brilliant bolt-hole from the Strip

reviews.text: Pros: It's very clean, has a nice pool, two bedroom suites with a full kitchen, washer/dryer and living room.
reviews.title: Nice but too expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Not really close to anything except Stratosphere, no room service, two little cafes that serve coffee and sandwiches/pizza type food only.
reviews.title: Nice enough place, a little out of the way...

reviews.text: This is perhaps the only hotel on the Las Vegas strip and vicinity that charges for self parking. Unfortunately, there is other alternative like parking in Circus Circus then walk 5 to 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Nice suite with full kitchen. $8 self park. Away from action.
What a ripoff!
reviews.text: The suite is very comfortable and roomy. Full kitchen, sofa bed, 2 large televisions, great view. Wifi fast. The Jacuzzi was very nice as well, however, I did not use because it seemed dirty.
There is nothing around without walking 5 to 10 minutes. Although there is a mini mart in the hotel, you pay for hotel prices. No casinos, so you’ll have to go somewhere else.
reviews.title: Not very exciting

reviews.text: We tried to book a stay for the tour. You basically sign up for a discounted package and then you receive a tour and you stay at the hotel. We called the three Hilton Grand Vacations hotels and none of them had a room. So, basically it was a scam and they should be ashamed of this scam. What a ripoff - Hilton should not put their name on this Grand vacations
reviews.title: Great stay..

reviews.text: i have mixed feelings about this hotel. It is quieter than the hotels in the heart of the Strip, but you can stay in a quiet hotel anywhere. You're in Las Vegas, for heaven's sake. It was just a little too dull for us. Inconvenient not to have a sit-down restauranr, although the outside poolside bar has a good casual menu. You will be at the very end of the Strip, so prepare for a bus, the monorail, a taxi, or a long walk. You're close to Circus Circus and the Stratosphere, but that's it.
reviews.title: Hilton Grand Vacations On The Strip - Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through the Hilton website and surprisingly this was one of the few hotels available. It was President's Day weekend and the NBA All-Star Game so Las Vegas was jammed.
reviews.title: Vegas Oasis

likes.liked: — Great room at a reasonable price
likes.disliked: — A little farther up the Strip than many would like

reviews.text: It was nice to have a hotel without a casino that was a little removed from most of the action even though it was long walk. We left the car in the lot behind the hotel and walked, which was faster than trying to drive on the Strip.
reviews.title: lovely hotel!!

reviews.text: This hotel has excellent, well-appointed and quiet rooms with a decent view. The large flat-screen TV was a bonus. Very clean and quiet with a friendly staff and a good marketplace downstairs for snacks and coffee at reasonable prices. The games room and gym were in excellent condition.
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.text: For a long weekend in Las Vegas we paid a very reasonable price and did not pay to park or have to attend a timeshare presentation.
reviews.title: Quiet Hotel away from the Chaos!

likes.liked: — quiet, smoke free location and free wifi

reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic! Can't Wait To Go Again!
reviews.text: We had an excellent dinner at Mon Ami Gabi in the Paris casino. Great food and very professional service in a much quieter atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for about a week in Feb. 2007 and can hardly wait to go back! We had one small problem with housekeeping not servicing our room but that was quickly taken care of. We were on the 23rd floor and I have never stayed at such a quiet hotel. It was awesome. If there was a way to get that bed strapped to the top of my car I would have stolen it! VERY comfortable. The little kitchen area was great as well as the laundry facilities. Parking was not a problem and getting on and off the main street was easy. Can't believe how good the price was for what we received. I dislike timeshares but if I was to ever consider one this would be it. Hope they keep up the great service and value.
reviews.title: Just great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed from 3/23 until 3/26 and had a great stay. We went on behalf of a Hilton property sales presentation, which was not a bad experience, and we actually purchased the vacation club after a few hours of "negotiating". The presentation was not high pressure at all, and had we not expressed some level of interest, I am confident the presentation would have only last approx. 90 minutes. About the property: very nice pool with outside bar serving a typical lunch menu and any drink you can think of with very good service and fair prices. The rooms were very nice, very large with flat screens, comfy beds lots of furniture, and some have full kitchens. they also have large bathrooms with a big walk-in shower. Downstairs there is a nice marketplace serving several kinds of food for each meal of the day, including package alcohol, soda pop, waters, juices, and Starbucks coffee. There is a huge fitness room, activity room with pool table, tvs, etc. There is also a spa which we did not visit. Parking is very convenient and free, with easy on/off access onto Las Vegas Blvd (the Strip). Overall, it was a great experience and now that we are owners with Hilton, will certainly be back many times over. If you are unsure about this property, please email any issues you may have and I'll honestly answer them. Book the trip and enjoy Vegas!!
reviews.title: Heck of a Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel from March 9th thru 13th.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was very clean and staff was very friendly.
reviews.title: very nice-we'll be back

likes.disliked: — no bar on property (but they did sell beer and wine in market)

reviews.text: We arrived in Vegas around noon, no problem checking in early.
reviews.title: Superior Service & Staff

reviews.text: As a hotel its very good - large well-equipped rooms - fairly good wifi - big TVs - wide range of channels - no movies but there is a small library of DVDs downstairs. The shop is fairly well-equipped but not much variety - a minor gripe they kept adding pickles to everything when I specifically asked them not to as I have allergies. The pool area is very good but suffers from the usual over loud music - most of the users were not MTV generation.
reviews.title: A very plush place - but small failings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had some issues with maintenance which were not resolved - a damaged dishwasher door which was probably not electrically safe and a washing machine with faulty lock that came open while running depositing water on the floor - luckily we were in at the time. Both were reported but not resolved.
reviews.title: Best Suite Prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are air-conditioned but this does not clear cooking smells which persisted all week.
reviews.title: Well Recieved
Nice and quiet
reviews.text: The hotel is a significant distance from the centre of the strip but the bus stops outside and cabs are nearly always available - cabs this time seemed very expensive for short journeys.

This hotel is pretty far north on the strip but if u want to be out of the busy part, it's a great choice. If u are not there for a timeshare presentation, they will not approach u for anything. It's really a very nice property, just small compared to other strip hotels. We always book the 1 bdrm suite b/c it has a washer and dryer. The rooms are clean and well equipped. They even give u detergent! Views are not so great b/c of the massive hotel being built across the street right now. However, it is really convenient to everything and it's very easy to get your car in and out. There is a small grocery store on the bottom floor which has just about everything. The rates average about $100 per nite. Valet is very fast. There is no casino here and not much of a lobby. However, they do have a business center if u need a computer or fax etc. The entire property is attractive and clean.
reviews.title: Birthday weekend getaway

aka: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites On The Las Vegas Strip Hotel Las Vegas
description: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on the Las Vegas Strip is located at the north end of the world-renowned Las Vegas Strip, offers convenience and luxury to business and leisure travelers with well appointed studios and one and two-bedroom suites. The resort is a short distance from the Las Vegas Convention Center and convenient to the I-15 Freeway, as well as easy access to nearby shopping, Fashion Show Mall and the Las Vegas Premium Outlets.
